page.title: 02Charlton Church,Wantage,Oxon
page.content: Charlton Village is now part of Wantage.Its church,Holy Trinity,was built in 1848 for the people living in the eastern part of the parish of Wantage. The assistant priest (Father Simon Evans) is responsible for taking the services and for visiting people at home.He also comes into the two Church Schools to take prayers and to teach. He has started a youth group which meets on Sunday evenings at his house.About 20 people over the age of 13 attend. He writes music and has composed a Wantage Mass which was used for the first time on St.Peter's Day 1985. Over the weekend of Trinity Sunday a flower festival was held. There was a concert by local people in the church on the Saturday and a barbecue in Father Simon's garden on the Sunday.
